snippet: Oeystein Maeland has been criticized for failing to face up to police shortcomings regarding far-right militant Anders Behring Breivik, who killed 77 people last year in a bombing in Oslo and a massacre at a youth summer camp.
abstract: Norway’s police chief Oeystein Maeland resigns, days after an independent commission found that the police could have prevented the far-right militant Anders Behring Breivik from killing 77 people in a bombing in Oslo and a massacre at a youth summer camp in 2011.
lead_paragraph: Oeystein Maeland has been criticized for failing to face up to police shortcomings regarding far-right militant Anders Behring Breivik, who killed 77 people last year in a bombing in Oslo and a massacre at a youth summer camp.

headline.main: Norway: Police Chief Steps Down After Critical Report
headline.print_headline: Norway: Police Chief Steps Down After Critical Report
